question: 13-year-old female child presented with recurrent sinusitis fever, ahralgia, respiratory distress, Hematuria and hypertension. Renal biopsy showed necrotizing granuloma. The anti proteinase-3 ANCA was positive. The most likely diagnosis is:
exp: Respiratory & Renal involvement along with positive c-ANCA (Anti Proteinase 3) indicates Wegener's Granulomatosis

question: Silk Road disease is:
exp: Behcet disease: high prevalence in countries along the Silk Road, extending from Japan to the eastern Mediterranean characterized by recurrent oral ulcerations, uveitis & skin abnormalities
